meanings.sent1: Carrying heavy boxes up the stairs was a great travail for him.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers endured much travail to finish the building on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat's travail to catch the elusive mouse was quite entertaining to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her journey through the stormy seas was a travail she would never forget.
meanings.sent5: The knight's battle against the dragon was a travail of epic proportions.

meanings.sent1: Farming the land was a daily travail for the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterpiece was the result of years of creative travail.
meanings.sent3: The chef's travail in the kitchen led to a delicious feast for all.
meanings.sent4: The explorer's trek through the jungle was a travail filled with discovery.
meanings.sent5: The student's academic travail paid off with a well-deserved diploma.

meanings.definition: To work hard or labor diligently
meanings.sent1: She had to travail for hours to complete the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The bees travail tirelessly to gather nectar for their hive.
meanings.sent3: He decided to travail through the night to finish his novel.
meanings.sent4: The athletes travail daily to improve their skills and performance.
meanings.sent5: The gardener will travail in the garden to ensure beautiful blooms in spring.
